mutualism like non-collectivist anarchism and individualist anarchism
none of those sources say mutualism is individualist anarchism. you have no basis for dispute.

further attribution, since this is his too
Correcting statement making an assertion as if it were fact on the opinion of one author.

please, you should wait the discussion, anyway mutualism is market anarchism, and market anarchism is prevalent individualist
moving mutualism out of the claim that it is individualist anarchism, giving sources for it occupying a midpoint between individualist and collectivist
source for mutualism being individualist anarchism?
it's market and property, please stop with that ilogical delete
what a bad redaction!, please, we are beging with political order issues
mutualism is not in the source as being non left wing
it's about market, individual property, etc.

some kinds of LS aren't A.
mmm, this redaction don't convice me in semantics, but in this moment is acceptable...
the source doesnt say militant! Regarding the other edit, Burton is not using "libertarianism" as a synonym for anarchism. That's why he's calling individualist anarchism "libertarian anarchism."
if are making a comparisson beetwen militant and philosophical A. This isn't against sources, is adjusting to the redaction. About libertarianism I wrote to you. + ref
maybe this explains a little better
if you want to say something in an article just find a source for it. you can't misrepresent the sources.
and what about anarcho-syndicalism that was the bigger anarchist mov.? About "libertarianism", please be semantical, the first part is about a historical use and last part is about the current use.
yes it is. the source specifically says "communist". And "libertarianism" is synonym for all anarchism, not just individualist. Look at the sources.
This isn' t against sources, is just for mantain the equilibrated line of the redaction.
no, this is not what the sources say. you can't change the text to make it look like the sources say something they don't.

/* William Godwin, the first expression of philosophical anarchism */
/* William Godwin, the first expression of philosophical anarchism= */
/* Egoist individualist anarchism */ it's just called "egoism" not "egoist individualist anarchism"
/* Individualist anarchism */ unequal rights and cooperation in labor are two different ideas
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Egoism */ condense, reword for accuracy and concision
/* Schools of thought */ corrections, link, weasel words, rm misplaced mathematical terminology and incoherent sentence
/* Origins */ nonsense, Godwin was all for discrimination.
/* Schools of thought */ individualist anarchism came before mutualism
/* Schools of thought */ if we're going to do order of development then anarchism withoud adjectives needs to be around here, not AFTER recent schools of thought
Ordered by time of development. Mutualism came first, them individualist, then social, then post-classical.
/* Schools of thought */ ok then, individualist anarchism falls inside both too if you reason it that way
/* Egoism */ rm image disrupting following unrelated section

it is in there already; read the table of contents before emabarrassing yourself: this section is divided quasi-chronologically by major classical schisms, then post-classical, and A w/o A which falls outside both
Any rational reason for not including anarchism without adjectives with the rest of the forms of anarchism?
/* Recent schools of thought */ use this formulation if you like

you're breaking up the sectarian anarchists chronologically ordered with the sole non-sectarian atemporal section, please leave the logical structure be. "Anarchism since the 60s" is not a school of thought
/* Recent schools of thought */ how is the 1960's "recent"?
it doesn't make sense break it up like that. Put anarchism without adjectives in with the other kinds of anarchism.
/* Fight against fascism */ This section is not as good a [[WP:LAY]] as it might be
which is precisely why it is not a subheading of anarchist schools of thought!
/* Schools of thought */ anarchism without adjectives is not a "recent school of thought.
loads of sources available for rothbard being an individualist
/* Individualist anarchism */ individualist anarchism != anarcho-capitalism, so Rothbard removed.

changing to what the source says. mutualism anyway is not individualist anarchism
not good changes ..not good reasons to support removal of information
ref was more a product page than a review, isn't about individualist @ as part of @ generally, and isn't needed since as Brooks covers it
"always included individualist strain ... including ancap & agorist" was misleading as these are more recent developments. Market-oriented covers them.
